intro: Derris mariannensis, commonly known as the Pacific Islands derris, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, particularly in the treatment of various ailments.
